result.execSummary:
The defendant Abigail J Lopez-Martinez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil Judgment for Restitution and Surcharges and Court Costs.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT Eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS Eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Sentence credit of 11 days was granted.

miscConds.notes: Restitution for the victim to be paid as a condition of probation and to be paid before costs or fines.  Restitution to be paid within the first year of probation.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia.  No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.

No contact with: Victims or their dental clinic.  Follow all court orders of a competent jurisdiction.  Maintain employment and/or school combination.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by the Agent.  
**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: With Huber.  Non-working hours - STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion.  Release for work, school, treatment, counseling and childcare.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Four character/treatment letters filed on behalf of the defendant by Attorney Zwach.

Defendant Abigail J Lopez-Martinez in court with attorney Sarah Zwach.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

4  YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 11 days)
  -  2 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  2 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

STAYED FOR

TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEARS;

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  

*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
*No contact with:  victims or their dental clinic. 
*Follow all court orders of a competent jurisdiction.
*Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

RESTITUTION:  $658.18 to victim, to be paid as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid within first year of probation and paid before costs or fines;

COURT COSTS:  $278.00 (includes $10.00 DRGOD assessment to be paid as a condition of probation;

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 to be paid as a condition of probation;

CONDITION TIME: 60 days non-working hours (Huber)  STAYED; to be used at agent's discretion.  Release for work, school, treatment, counseling and childcare. 

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Sentencing hearing on September 16, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
